info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 6 at 10:39PM EDT until May 7 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Ohio...
Black River At Elyria affecting Lorain County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio...
Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Wayne and Holmes Counties.
Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio...
Eagle Creek Above Findlay affecting Hancock County.
For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Eagle Creek (Hancock)...including Findlay...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Eagle Creek (Trumbull)...including Phalanx Station...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring.
* WHERE...Black River at Elyria.
* WHEN...Until late tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Flooding begins south of Elyria in Carlisle Township along Woodside Drive.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 6.3 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/cle.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT
